definitionEn: the condition of not being present
exampleEn: His absence from the training session was noticed by the boss.
His tennis career ended abruptly when he suffered a serious injury.
an abnormally large amount of calcium in the blood.

definitionEn: not normal
exampleEn: His behaviour/behavior is abnormal for a child of his age.

definitionEn: in a higher position than
exampleEn: The picture was hanging above the fireplace.

definitionEn: higher up
exampleEn: Here’s a photo of the city seen from above.

definitionEn: the power, knowledge etc to do something
exampleEn: She has the ability to win the race

definitionEn: an original inhabitant of a country, especially of Australia
exampleEn: The Aborigines were the first people to set foot on the Australian continent.

definitionEn: on(to) or in(to) (a means of transport)
exampleEn: He made us really feel that his boat was our home while we were aboard

definitionEn: having been left without any intention of returning to or reclaiming
exampleEn: The police found the abandoned vehicle.

definitionEn: used to say that you can do a particular action to something
exampleEn: a foldable chair

definitionEn: (opposite unable) having enough strength, knowledge etc to do something
exampleEn: She was eventually able to open the door.

definitionEn: (with to) hate
exampleEn: Any form of violence was abhorrent to him.
